CONVERSATION GROUP: BK was "The Hall is completely wrecked!"
BK was "There seem to be quite a lot of dead bodies, too."
BK was "He was just a bookkeeper. He'd man the front counter and negotiate our guild contracts."
We should look around his office for anything that might hold more info.
Looks like they made it down here, too.
Ha! It was here the whole time? That's pretty clever.
This was where the guild performed its rituals and rites of passage.
I dunno, I haven't joined any others. We had to earn our way to even become an initiate. You're not really a member of the guild until you've proven yourself.

BK Was Hey! This is the guild log book.
BK was "That's where we keep the receipts of every job we take. It includes info like who we assign, how much the guild is being paid, who the client is, and so on."
BK was 'It looks really beat up."
BK was "Yeah, that's because a good chunk of it is missing! It looks like someone ripped out the last three months worth of logs."
BK was "Yeah, I hate to admit it, but I think you're right. Damn, no one is safe if they have that." (Moving some info around -- pulling in survivor note up to here.)
BK was Yeah, I don't know how, but we gotta try. Maybe we'll be able to track down some survivors too!

BK was This book seems to detail the initiation process of the guild, but there are numerous missing pages and beer stains that obscure most of the information.
CVS - Put the signet ring line at the end, since it's no longer a part of the ritual, but it's going to become a quest reward of sorts.
...the first verse declares... founders' heritage... original members of the guild....

One entry reads: "Just learned the chant today! It's great, I just wish it wasn't a secret. My friends back home would really get a kick out of it! Especially the line "In the dark, we march on". Reminds me of my dungeon delving days!
One entry reads: "I have the each line memorized, but the order is still getting me. I just gotta remember... FAIL."

A hastily scribbled entry is on the final page: "Something is happening downstairs. I don't know what, but I heard arguing and someone screaming the name Jessia! I hope it isn't the assassin Jessia..."
"There's fighting breaking out downstairs! If I'm dead when you find this, please, avenge me!!"

We finally made it into the armory! Looks like none of those bastards made it in here.

Well, I doubt there's a ton of stuff left, especially with most of us out on jobs. But I'm sure we can find something useful!
If I had to guess, I'm thinking probably goes to the Armory upstairs.

Too bad it's broken. We could take it to the Blacksmith in the square. I bet he could fix it!
